net.proteusframework.core.io

Class UUEncodeOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.FilterOutputStream
        • net.proteusframework.core.io.UUEncodeOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class UUEncodeOutputStream
extends java.io.FilterOutputStream
    Uuencodes an 8-bit stream using the base64 method. The output characters are [A-Z][a-z][0-9]+/= . No headers or footers are written. The uuencode system encodes an 8-bit binary stream into the printable alphanumeric and {+,/,=} characters. Each three characters are encoded into four, resulting in a 25% increase in size. The unit of encoding is called a word here.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)
